Invisibility is a Spell in Baldur's Gate 3. Invisibility is a Lvl 2 Spell from the Illusion school. Spells can be used for dealing damage to Enemies, inflict Status Ailments, buff Characters or interact with the environment.

Invisibility Information

Description: Touch a creature to turn it Invisible. Attacks against it have Disadvantage. It attacks with Advantage. Invisibility breaks when you fail Stealth Checks on attacking, casting spells or interacting with items Condition ends early if the creature attacks or casts a spell. Level: Lvl 2 spell School: Illusion School Casting Time: Action Duration: 10 turns Range: Melee Requires Concentration: Yes Saving Throw: None

How to Acquire Invisibility

Invisibility can be acquired by the following classes or races: Bard, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard, Circle of the Land (Grassland Spell Circle) Duergar Invisibility can be cast by using the following Items: Fetish of Callarduran Smoothhands, requires a Long Rest.

Bard, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard, Circle of the Land (Grassland Spell Circle) Duergar

Fetish of Callarduran Smoothhands, requires a Long Rest.

Invisibility Tips & Notes

Invisibility lasts 10 turns as of Early Access patch 9. Invisibility will not break upon casting the Minor Illusion cantrip, or upon looting a container. Note that interacting with non-container objects WILL break the spell. The Duergar racial version of this spell has no duration, and can be cast for free an unlimited number of times outside of combat. However, it does not offer Stealth checks to allow its effect to be maintained after interacting with an object, casting a spell, or attacking. It will always break immediately. As of v4.1.1.4251417 of the game, there is a bug with the Level 2 version of this spell that makes it act the same way as the Duergar racial in regards to breaking immediately upon any interaction. It never offers Stealth checks to maintain the effect. Only Greater Invisibility offers such checks. Or perhaps the bug is that the Level 2 spell's tooltip is incorrect, and the entire line about stealth checks isn't supposed to be there.
